00059 #ifndef HEADER_BLOWFISH_H
00060 #define HEADER_BLOWFISH_H
00061 
00062 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00063 extern "C" {
00064 #endif
00065 
00066 #define BF_ENCRYPT      1
00067 #define BF_DECRYPT      0
00068 
00069 /* If you make this 'unsigned int' the pointer variants will work on
00070  * the Alpha, otherwise they will not.  Strangly using the '8 byte'
00071  * BF_LONG and the default 'non-pointer' inner loop is the best configuration
00072  * for the Alpha */
00073 #define BF_LONG unsigned long
00074 
00075 #define BF_ROUNDS       16
00076 #define BF_BLOCK        8
00077 
00078 typedef struct bf_key_st
00079         {
00080         BF_LONG P[BF_ROUNDS+2];
00081         BF_LONG S[4*256];
00082         } BF_KEY;
00083 
00084 /* #ifndef NOPROTO */
00085 #ifndef PROTOTYPES
00086  
00087 void BF_set_key(BF_KEY *key, int len, unsigned char *data);
00088 void BF_ecb_encrypt(unsigned char *in,unsigned char *out,BF_KEY *key,
00089         int enc);
00090 void BF_encrypt(BF_LONG *data,BF_KEY *key,int enc);
00091 void BF_cbc_encrypt(unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out, long length,
00092         BF_KEY *ks, unsigned char *iv, int enc);
00093 void BF_cfb64_encrypt(unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out, long length,
00094         BF_KEY *schedule, unsigned char *ivec, int *num, int enc);
00095 void BF_ofb64_encrypt(unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out, long length,
00096         BF_KEY *schedule, unsigned char *ivec, int *num);
00097 char *BF_options(void);
00098 
00099 #else
00100 
00101 void BF_set_key();
00102 void BF_ecb_encrypt();
00103 void BF_encrypt();
00104 void BF_cbc_encrypt();
00105 void BF_cfb64_encrypt();
00106 void BF_ofb64_encrypt();
00107 char *BF_options();
00108 
00109 #endif
00110 
00111 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00112 }
00113 #endif
00114 
00115 #endif
